data.title: Good dinner before a concert
data.text: Went here this weekend before a concert at the Peabody. It was a calm Thursday night and we had great service. The portion sizes of food was ridiculous and huge. We tried each others' food and it was all good, but not over the top great. The location, atmosphere and service was great. Parking was easy, but this was not a busy Thursday night so not sure about a weekend.

owner_response.author: Cass K, Public Relations Manager at Alumni St Louis, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for the review! We're glad that you visited us before your concert and hope you had a great night overall!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Worst Customer Service ever
data.text:
The manager/bartender/whatever, Ashley, is flat-out rude to any customer who isn't her "favorite".  She has a nasty attitude, and doesn't need to be in a customer service position. Period. She has just lost your restaurant a lot of money in business, because we'll be taking our business elsewhere. 

Food is marginal. For the money, go elsewhere.

data.title: Alumnus of Alumni
data.text: A restaurant I eat at often (makes me an alumnus).  Love clean, modern look and windows allowing me to gaze at the City views.  Recommend Loop Salad with couscous,  cranberries,  and tangy dressing.  Kudos to staff who willing to make your  eating experience perfect.

owner_response.author: Cass K, Public Relations Manager at Alumni St Louis, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for your review Barb!  You're a true 'alumnus', and we hope to continue seeing you!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great food and service
data.text: Get the Championship Rings... onion rings with bacon in beer batter!  The Secret Weapon cubano was amazing. Nice setting, good service. Hope to go back soon.

owner_response.author: Torrie W, Public Relations Manager at Alumni St Louis, responded to this review
owner_response.text: As a representative for Alumni, I'd like to thank you for your positive feedback. We're so glad to hear how much you enjoyed dining with us and hope to see you again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great food, wonderful atmosphere
data.text: We found this place while in town for a show. My wife had the South Town and loved it. I had the STL Cheesesteak, it was delicious. You will not go away hungry as the portions are very large, enough to take some home. The atmosphere is very nice and the waitstaff very attentive. Highly recommend trying this place.

owner_response.author: Torrie W, Public Relations Manager at Alumni St Louis, responded to this review
owner_response.text: As a representative for Alumni, I'd like to thank you for your positive feedback. We're so glad to hear how much you enjoyed dining with us and hope to see you again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great Food and Great Staff
data.text: I went here as part of an official party (after a book release/reading at the Library), chosen by the Missouri Humanities Council. I'm glad they did. The staff were all great in handling a large crowd (~30 people), and the food choices were great. They also had a pretty extensive list of drinks available.

owner_response.author: Torrie W, Public Relations Manager at Alumni St Louis, responded to this review
owner_response.text: As a representative for Alumni, I would like to thank you for your positive feedback. We are so glad to hear the staff was able to provide your group with a great dining experience, and that you enjoyed the food and drinks. We hope that you will visit us again in the future!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Lunch
data.text:
Really nice authentic St. Louis restaurant. If you're downtown and looking for some local flavor this is your spot. Extensive menu from soups, salads, pastas to pizza, seafood and a full bar. 

They've got pool tables, dart boards, plenty of seating and pleasant staff.

owner_response.author: Torrie W, Public Relations Manager at Alumni St Louis, responded to this review
owner_response.text: As a representative for Alumni St. Louis, I would like to thank you for your positive feedback! We are glad to hear how much you enjoyed dining with us and hope that you will visit us again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: a great surprise
data.text: First time here and the food was really great  and had a mar Quartz that was top of the line. The serves was excellent. Everyone. Super nice and friendly people serving at this place

data.title: Good food. Good service.
data.text: Visited in mid afternoon between event sessions at Scottrade Center. Found staff attentive and service efficient. French onion soup was delicious and served perfectly. Greek chicken wrap was well prepared with interesting combination. Delicious flavor. Red Bird chicken sandwich had a very good flavor. Menu had variety with an appropriate number of choices.  Very attractive interior. Will return.

data.title: Not what I expected
data.text: Service was excellent.  But, food was hardly even average.  French Onion soup was terrible, and had a very odd smell I actually had to sit my napkin on top of the bowl so that I couldn't smell it, Chicken Marsala was decent but unlike any I had ever had before, I got a salted caramel brownie to go and only took a few bites, it may be better if you get with the ice cream.

data.title: Great Experience
data.text: My husband and I stopped at Alumni for dinner and drinks before a concert we were attending.  We sat in the bar area, and the bartender was very attentive.  We are not from the area and had no experience with the craft beer options, so she brought us a few samples to taste, which we were impressed with.  Oftentimes, servers just recommend items without offering a taste, so it was a great touch!  We started with the Championship Rings, which were onion rings wrapped in bacon and deep fried.  They were good, but the bacon was a little chewy for my taste.  I had the Italian Steak Sandwich, which might be the best steak sandwich I have ever had.  The steak was seasoned well and very tender, and the sauce and cheese served with it were amazing.  I chose sweet potato chips to go with my sandwich, and they were also delicious.  My husband had a BBQ burger of some sort (I don't remember the name), but it was two beef patties, with BBQ pork and a fried bacon onion ring on top.  It was also quite good, though I was partial to my own.  There was a pretty decent crowd (seemed like many other concert-goers), but the service was very attentive.  We'd go back if we were ever in the area!  A plus - we were able to walk to the Scottrade Center in about 5 minutes!

data.title: Attentive Service, Great Food
data.text: It was a perfect evening to dine outside with views of the renovated Library and the War Memorial and a gorgeous sunset to set the mood. Our server was on spot and timed her visits nicely. Delicious entrees and in ample proportions; luckily our younger son and daughter-in-law could take home the extra bounty as we were back to our road trip the next day.

data.title: Good food, Service?
data.text:
After reading of the reviews that were posted I have to agree that the food was very good in almost every aspect, but service was very lacking. The restaurant was pretty much empty as it was a snowy evening and I would expect better attention if no other tables needed attention. Very friendly and great conversation, but did not come by enough to fill water and check up on us.

Highlights were the fresh taste of the short ribs. Out standing tenderness and flavor profile. Mayfair salad very tasty but really needed to be a bit bigger and French Onion soup had a burnt undertone.

We may try it again. Always willing to give second chances. Love the decor!

data.title: Revitalizing St Louis through the dining experience
data.text:
A great new establishment in downtown St Louis, part of the revitalizing efforts of the area.  Located right across the street from the park and the renovated library, Alumni is ritzy, yet casual, and the extensive menu for both cuisine and drinks are outstanding.  I dined with my friend and her husband and we were all impressed.  The menu is a fusion of new and old, with a mix of traditional St Louis cuisine.  We started with (my first time) toasted ravioli, an interesting mix of flavor and texture.  I ordered the tasty fish taco – first time having salmon vice tuna (or cod).  My friend ordered the glutton-free pasta and her husband ordered the beef medallion – all were prepared well and were flavorful.

We dined early (before a corporate group took over the restaurant) and had the opportunity to talk to the chef/owner of the establishment.  He is rightfully proud of his creation and there is good reason – great food and drinks.  In addition to the usual products, he has on tap, several local breweries that produce outstanding beer.
Alumni can be a place for casual dining or brining clients for cocktails or meals, a unique blend of new and old, classy and casual… worth visiting again.

data.title: Stylish decor, varied menu.
data.text: Visited Alumni STL last week.  The bar area and dining room are very stylish, and sleek.  The menu has many options for dinner.  Great variety of appetizers.  You can have pizza, burgers, salads, or go for a full entree.  It's great when a restaurant offers such a wide range of selections.  It won't break the bank either.  Nice outside dining area.  The only negative about that is there is a park right across the street where the homeless hangout.  Chef came around to the tables too. Great addition to the downtown dining scene.

data.title: Where did you go to high school?
data.text:
Sorry I had to start with an inside joke.  If you ever lived in St. Louis no matter how old you are people will ask where to went to high school.  I went to Alumni as they participated in Downtown Restaurant Week which is great you get to try out new places for a very reasonable price and make a donation (please do) to help feed others.  It's not hard to find if your downtown, I called to make sure where they were and I asked about parking I was told there was metered parking in front and I asked about valet parking and was then told that there is free parking in the garage for up to two hours they validate.  In retrospect the validated parking should have been the first words out of his mouth when I asked about parking.

I was dining with a family member we eat out a lot so I think my reviews are pretty even keeled and fair.  This place makes it connection with St Louis with some of the food they serve their decore and trivia cards on the table.  Loved the decore they did a great job.

One thing you'll learn about St Louis is we are the birth place of toasted ravioli so make sure you have some while you are here.  During this week for $25 you get to choose an appetizer, entree and dessert from a fixed menu.  Lots of choices so we started with the toasted ravioli and crab rangoon appetizers.  The ravioli was ok not great just ok.  Frankly I have had better.  I'm a purest I like my ravioli square, these were shaped like a meat pie or half moon.  In my opinion the dough was too thick and the meat was not well spiced I thought they were rather bland.  Now the crab rangoon was like a deconstructed crab rangoon.  It was served in a bowl topped with two avacado slices and half of a grape tomato.It was served with a pile of pita chips I say pita because they were thicker than wonton chips.  I did not care for it.  To me crab rangoon should taste like crab.  This did not.  The color was off it was a brownish color.  The crab rangoon I've eaten is white and fluffy.  I was disappointed in this.

Now the entrees which were the saving grace.  I had the roasted chicken with mushroom polenta and brussel sprouts.  It was very good.  The chicken was moist, the polenta was delicious and the sprouts were very good not bitter.  My sister had something that was like a shishkabob with beef and other meats mixed in it came with pasta and broccolini.  She enjoyed her dinner also.  The desserts were good I had the chocolate cake (more like fudge) and my sis the 7up tart.  I thought both dishes should have been cold, they were room temprature.  The chocolate cake I can buy that on but the tart should have been chilled.

The waiter was very efficient he moved with lightening speed but I felt he could have been a little more personable and friendly.  Now the gripe I have is that I had leftovers of my polenta and chicken and my sister had her veggies and a small piece of meat left over.  I asked the waiter to pack all of it up in a box.  Well when I looked at it the next day he only packed the meat.  None of the veggies or my polenta of which I had about half left.  I was disappointed, I really liked the polenta!

So there you go I'd go back but I'd order different appetizers and probably skip the dessert.

data.title: Hip Decor, Interesting Menu, Attentive Service
data.text:
We recently ate lunch two days in a row at Alumni St Louis. First impression of this new downtown restaurant was how cool a look it had. Very comfortable and fun. On both occasions we were seated promptly and drink orders taken right away. I had fish tacos one day, pulled pork the next. Both were excellent. The fish tacos differed from the normal tilapia and instead featured maple glazed salmon. The flour tacos(corn are an option) and filling of a corn and slaw type salad were also delicious. I had zucchini fries which were also good and made me feel virtuous.

The pulled pork was also delicious, served with cheese and cole slaw on a bun. I had regular fries as a side. The pork was actually pulled and smooth and free of those chunky burnt bits you usually find in this kind of sandwich.

On both days my companions were pleased with their food also.

Service was pleasant and attentive without being obtrusive. Separate checks were not a problem. Right now, before the law students descend, there are plenty of meters available nearby.

One downside: restrooms are quite a hike, out of the restaurant across a building lobby.
